resource_dependency.company_data_schema: Database schema includes: company_id (UUID), company_name (string), industry (string), headquarters_location (string), fiscal_year_end (date), created_at (timestamp), updated_at (timestamp).
resource_dependency.financial_data_schema: Database schema includes: financial_id (UUID), company_id (foreign key to companies table), report_period (date), revenue (decimal), expenses (decimal), profit (decimal), assets (decimal), liabilities (decimal), equity (decimal), created_at (timestamp), updated_at (timestamp).
resource_dependency.auth_api: Authentication API for user login/logout and session management. Requires JWT tokens for secure access.
resource_dependency.external_db_config: Environment variables: DB_HOST=localhost, DB_PORT=5432, DB_USERNAME=myappuser, DB_PASSWORD=myapppassword, DB_NAME=myapp

function: To display a teal-themed financial dashboard with a mint cream background that enables users to manage and visualize financial data from multiple companies.
static_description: The dashboard features a responsive layout with teal-styled components and a mint cream background. It displays a header bar with navigation links, a sidebar menu for company selection, and a main content area showing financial data cards or charts grouped by company. All UI elements are styled using the teal color scheme.

interaction_and_states.description: On a company name in the sidebar to switch between different companies and view their respective financial data.
Over a financial metric card to show additional details or tooltip information about the value.
On a 'View Details' button within a financial card to navigate to a detailed page for that companyâ€™s financials.

resource_dependency.company_table_api: API endpoint to retrieve list of companies with basic info such as company_id, company_name, and industry.
resource_dependency.financial_report_api: API endpoint to fetch financial reports for a selected company including revenue, expenses, profit, assets, liabilities, and equity.
resource_dependency.consolidated_summary_api: API endpoint to fetch aggregated financial summary data across multiple companies.
resource_dependency.comparison_chart_component: Component to render interactive charts comparing financial metrics between companies.

function: To allow users to browse financial data from each company in a structured and organized manner.
static_description: Displays a structured view of financial data categorized by company. Each company is represented by a card or section containing key financial metrics like revenue, profit, and equity. Cards are arranged in a responsive grid layout with consistent spacing and styling.

interaction_and_states.description: On a company card to expand and show more detailed financial metrics.
Through the list of company cards to load additional data dynamically.

resource_dependency.consolidated_report_api: API endpoint to retrieve consolidated financial summaries across all companies, including total revenue, combined profit, and overall asset valuation.
resource_dependency.report_generation_ui: UI element to trigger generation of consolidated reports with filters for date range and company selection.

function: To provide consolidated financial reports that aggregate data across multiple companies.
static_description: Includes a dedicated section for consolidated financial summaries showing totals and averages across all companies. This area presents key financial indicators such as total revenue, combined profit, and asset distribution using visualizations.

interaction_and_states.description: On the 'Generate Report' button to initiate the creation of a consolidated financial report.
On filter options to customize the report based on selected date ranges or specific companies.

resource_dependency.comparison_tool_api: API endpoint to compare financial metrics between selected companies, returning comparative data sets.
resource_dependency.chart_visualization_component: Charting library component capable of rendering line graphs, bar charts, and pie charts for comparison purposes.
resource_dependency.multi_select_ui: User interface element allowing selection of multiple companies for side-by-side financial comparisons.

function: To enable cross-company financial comparisons and reporting capabilities.
static_description: Features a comparison tool panel that allows users to select two or more companies and view their financial performance side-by-side. Charts and tables are displayed in a tabbed interface with toggleable views.

interaction_and_states.description: On the 'Compare Companies' button to open the multi-select modal for choosing companies.
On chart tabs to switch between different types of visualizations (line, bar, etc.).

resource_dependency.frontend_api_integration: Frontend codebase configured to fetch all financial data from backend endpoints via RESTful APIs.

function: To implement a frontend that fetches all financial data from backend APIs without using hard-coded or mock data.
static_description: The frontend application is built to communicate directly with backend services through HTTP requests. Data is fetched dynamically upon user actions and rendered in real-time within the dashboard UI components.

interaction_and_states.description: Upon initial page load, frontend calls API endpoints to fetch company list and latest financial data.
On refresh buttons or navigation links to re-fetch updated financial data from the backend.

resource_dependency.backend_db_connection: Backend service configured to connect to an external PostgreSQL database using environment variables.
resource_dependency.db_tables_setup: PostgreSQL database setup script to create tables for companies and financial records.

function: To include a backend service that connects to an external PostgreSQL database.
static_description: The backend service handles database connectivity to an external PostgreSQL instance. It manages data storage and retrieval for company profiles and financial records.

interaction_and_states.description: On server start-up, backend establishes connection to PostgreSQL database using provided environment variables.

resource_dependency.env_vars: Environment variables set to DB_HOST=localhost, DB_PORT=5432, DB_USERNAME=myappuser, DB_PASSWORD=myapppassword, DB_NAME=myapp

function: To configure the backend to use specific environment variables for database connection.
static_description: The backend configuration reads and applies environment variables for connecting to the PostgreSQL database. These variables are used during runtime to establish secure database connections.

interaction_and_states.description: During application boot-up, environment variables are read to initialize database connection parameters.

resource_dependency.api_endpoints: All data endpoints are dynamically connected to the database to prevent usage of hardcoded or mock data.
resource_dependency.dynamic_data_fetch: Frontend uses asynchronous API calls to ensure real-time data updates.

function: To support dynamic retrieval of financial data without hard-coded or mock data.
static_description: All financial data presented in the dashboard is retrieved dynamically from the backend database through API calls. No static values are embedded in the frontend code.

interaction_and_states.description: On data refresh button to force reload current financial data from backend.

resource_dependency.teal_color_scheme: CSS framework applying teal as primary color throughout all components.
resource_dependency.responsive_design: Media queries and flexible layouts to maintain consistency across screen sizes.

function: To ensure all components are styled consistently with a teal color scheme.
static_description: Every UI component adheres to a consistent teal-based color palette. Buttons, headers, cards, and visual elements utilize shades of teal for branding and visual hierarchy.

resource_dependency.responsive_layout_framework: CSS grid and flexbox layout system supporting mobile-first responsive design principles.
resource_dependency.financial_data_visualization: Charting libraries integrated to handle responsive chart rendering.

function: To create a responsive dashboard layout suitable for financial data visualization.
static_description: Dashboard layout adjusts dynamically based on viewport size. Financial data is presented in responsive grids, charts resize appropriately, and navigation adapts for smaller screens while maintaining usability.

interaction_and_states.description: When browser window is resized, layout rearranges components to fit available space.

resource_dependency.detailed_view_ui: Detailed financial information page accessible via click events from company cards.
resource_dependency.financial_metrics_display: Structured presentation of detailed metrics including revenue breakdowns, expense categories, and balance sheet items.

function: To provide functionality to view detailed financial information per company.
static_description: Each company card includes a link to a detailed view page. This page shows in-depth financial statements including income statements, balance sheets, and cash flow reports with full transparency of underlying figures.

interaction_and_states.description: On a company card or detail link to navigate to a detailed financial overview page.

resource_dependency.summary_generation_api: API endpoint to calculate and return consolidated financial summaries.
resource_dependency.summary_display_ui: UI component to render and present summarized financial data in an easy-to-understand format.

function: To enable users to generate and view consolidated financial summaries.
static_description: A centralized section within the dashboard presents summarized financial insights derived from all companies. Summaries include totals, percentages, trends, and highlights relevant to executive decision-making.

interaction_and_states.description: On the 'Generate Summary' button to update the consolidated financial overview with latest data.

resource_dependency.filter_sort_ui: Filter and sort controls applied to financial data listings.
resource_dependency.sorting_options: Options for sorting by company name, time period, revenue, or profit.
resource_dependency.filter_criteria: Filters for selecting companies, date ranges, or financial categories.

function: To support filtering and sorting of financial data by company or time period.
static_description: Provides a control panel above financial data displays allowing users to filter by company, date range, and financial category. Sorting options appear as dropdown menus or toggle switches next to data lists.

interaction_and_states.description: From dropdown menus to apply filters to financial data listings.
On sorting indicators to reorder data by various criteria.

resource_dependency.authentication_service: Backend API for handling user authentication and role-based access control.
resource_dependency.login_form_ui: Secure login form with username/password fields and remember me option.
resource_dependency.role_based_access: User roles such as admin, manager, viewer with differing permissions.

function: To implement user authentication and authorization for accessing financial data.
static_description: Access to the dashboard requires successful login with credentials. User roles determine which parts of the dashboard they can see or modify. Authentication status is reflected in the top-right corner of the UI.

interaction_and_states.description: Submitting login form initiates authentication process and redirects authenticated users to the dashboard.
On logout button to terminate session and redirect to login page.

resource_dependency.package_json_config: Configuration in package.json file specifying scripts for installing both frontend and backend dependencies, and running both servers concurrently.
resource_dependency.concurrent_execution: Use of npm-run-all or similar tools to execute frontend and backend servers simultaneously.

function: To configure package.json with npm run install:all and npm run dev scripts for concurrent frontend and backend startup.
static_description: The root directory contains a package.json file with predefined scripts. Running 'npm run install:all' installs dependencies for both frontend and backend projects. Running 'npm run dev' starts both applications concurrently.

interaction_and_states.description: Executing 'npm run install:all' installs all required packages for frontend and backend projects.
Executing 'npm run dev' launches the development servers for both frontend and backend.
